docs.title: Interactive Course Portal
docs.text: Welcome to your complete physics learning environment. Explore modules, practice problems, simulations, and reviews — all in one place.

docs.title: 🚀 Start Here
docs.text: - :rocket: **Begin Learning**    ---   Start with the fundamentals of 1D and 2D motion using calculus.    [Start Week 1 →](week1/index.md)  - :book: **View Syllabus**    ---   Course structure, grading, expectations, and weekly schedule.    [Open Syllabus →](syllabus.md)  - :mag: **Search the Course**    ---   Instantly find any formula, example, or topic using the search bar.    Use the 🔍 icon in the top-right.

docs.title: 📘 Course Modules
docs.text: - :one: **Week 1 — Kinematics**    ---   Motion in 1D, derivatives, integrals, free fall, displacement, velocity, acceleration.    [Go to Week 1 →](week1/index.md)  - :two: **Week 2 — Vectors & 2D Motion**    ---   Components, unit vectors, dot product, projectile motion, circular motion.    [Go to Week 2 →](week2/index.md)  - :three: **Week 3 — Forces & Newton’s Laws**    ---   Dynamics, free-body diagrams, friction, tension, Newton’s laws, applications.    [Go to Week 3 →](week3/index.md)  - :four: **Week 4 — Work & Energy**    ---   Work-energy theorem, kinetic & potential energy, conservative vs. non-conservative forces.    [Go to Week 4 →](week4/index.md)  - :five: **Week 5 — Momentum & Collisions**    ---   Impulse-momentum theorem, elastic/inelastic collisions, center of mass.    [Go to Week 5 →](week5/index.md)  - :six: **Week 6 — Rotational Motion**    ---   Rotational kinematics & dynamics, torque, moment of inertia.    [Go to Week 6 →](week6/index.md)  - :seven: **Week 7 — SHM & Gravitation**    ---   Springs, pendulums, oscillations, universal gravitation, orbital motion.    [Go to Week 7 →](week7/index.md)  - :eight: **Week 8 — Thermodynamics**    ---   Temperature, heat transfer, ideal gases, first law of thermodynamics.    [Go to Week 8 →](week8/index.md)

docs.title: 🧪 Interactive Tools
docs.text: - :chart_with_upwards_trend: **Simulations**    ---   Test motion graphs, forces, energy, and waves with interactive demos.    *Coming soon.*  - :pencil2: **Practice Problems**    ---   Challenge problems with instant solutions to test your understanding.    *Coming soon.*  - :zap: **Exam Reviews**    ---   Guided review modules for each exam with summaries & practice quizzes.    *Coming soon.*

docs.title: 🧩 About the Course
docs.text:
This course combines physics + calculus to help you master:

  • motion in 1D & 2D
  • forces & Newton’s laws
  • rotational dynamics
  • energy & momentum
  • oscillations & waves
  • thermodynamics

You will learn to: - model physical systems - solve problems using derivatives & integrals - build intuition with diagrams & graphs - analyze real-world phenomena

# 🎉 Ready to Begin? [Start Week 1 →](week1/index.md){ .md-button .md-button--primary .md-button--large }

docs.title: 🧭 Week 1 — Units, Dimensions, & 1D Kinematics (with Calculus)
docs.text:
Welcome to Week 1! This module is designed so you can fully learn physics on your own, even if you missed class.

Use the expandable sections below to navigate without endless scrolling.

docs.title: 🎯 Learning Objectives
docs.text:
By the end of Week 1, you will be able to:

  • Convert and analyze units & dimensions
  • Understand position, velocity, and acceleration
  • Use derivatives and integrals to model motion
  • Interpret motion graphs
  • Solve real-world motion problems
  • Model free fall

docs.title: 📘 1. Units & Dimensions
docs.text:
1.1 SI Base Units (click to expand) Quantity Unit Symbol Length meter m Mass kilogram kg Time second s Temperature kelvin K Electric current ampere A 1.2 Dimensions (click to expand)

Dimensions describe what type of physical quantity something is.

\[ \text{Velocity}: [L][T^{-1}] \] \[ \text{Acceleration}: [L][T^{-2}] \] \[ \text{Force}: [M][L][T^{-2}] \]

❌ Incorrect Equation Example

\[ v = 3t + 7x \]
  • Left side: \([L/T]\)
  • Right side: \(3t \rightarrow [T]\), \(7x \rightarrow [L]\)

Units do not match → equation is invalid.

1.3 Unit Conversion Example (click)

Convert 60 mph to m/s:

\[ 60 \frac{\text{mi}}{\text{hr}} \cdot \frac{1609\ \text{m}}{1\ \text{mi}} \cdot \frac{1\ \text{hr}}{3600\ \text{s}} = 26.8\ \text{m/s} \]

docs.title: 📘 2. Position, Velocity, and Acceleration
docs.text:
\[ v(t) = \frac{dx}{dt} \qquad a(t) = \frac{dv}{dt} \]

These are definitions from calculus applied to motion.

docs.title: 🧩 Concept → Example → Try It
docs.text:
ConceptExampleTry It Yourself
  • Position \(x(t)\) tells where something is.
  • Velocity \(v(t)\) is how fast position changes.
  • Acceleration \(a(t)\) is how fast velocity changes.

Given: [ x(t)=t^3 - 4t + 2 ] Then: [ v(t)=3t^2 - 4 ] [ a(t)=6t ]

Find velocity & acceleration if: [ x(t)=5t^2 - 3t + 8 ]

Show Solution

[ v(t)=10t - 3 ] [ a(t)=10 ]

docs.title: 📘 3. Integrals in Kinematics
docs.text:
Integration reconstructs motion when velocity or acceleration is known.

Constant AccelerationNon-Constant AccelerationFree Fall \[ v(t)=v_0 + at \] \[ x(t)=x_0 + v_0 t + \frac{1}{2}at^2 \]

Example: [ a(t)=4t ] [ v(t)=2t^2 + C ]

\[ a = g = 9.8\ \text{m/s}^2 \] \[ v(t)=gt + v_0 \] \[ x(t)=x_0 + v_0 t + \frac{1}{2}gt^2 \]

docs.title: 📘 4. Reading Motion Graphs
docs.text:
Click to expand

Position graph → slope → velocity Velocity graph → slope → acceleration Velocity graph → area → displacement

Understanding graphs is essential for Test 1.

docs.title: 🎓 5. Worked Examples
docs.text:
Example 1 — From x(t) to v(t) and a(t)

[ x(t)=4t^3 - 2t ] [ v(t)=12t^2 - 2 ] [ a(t)=24t ]

Example 2 — Dropped Object

A ball is dropped from height 20 m.

Velocity after 2 s: [ v=gt=9.8(2)=19.6\ \text{m/s} ]

Position: [ x = 20 - \frac{1}{2}(9.8)(2^2) = 0.4\ \text{m} ]

Example 3 — Integrating Non-Constant Acceleration \[ a(t)=6t,\quad v(0)=3 \] \[ v(t)=3t^2 + 3 \] \[ x(t)=t^3 + 3t \]

docs.title: 📝 6. Practice Problems
docs.text:
1. Given \(x(t)=2t^3 - 5t^2 + 7\), find \(v(t)\) and \(a(t)\) Show Answer

[ v(t)=6t^2 - 10t ] [ a(t)=12t - 10 ]

2. A car accelerates from rest at 4 m/s² for 5 s Show Answer \[ x = \frac{1}{2}at^2 = \frac{1}{2}(4)(25)=50\ \text{m} \] 3. A ball is thrown upward at 12 m/s Show Answer \[ h=\frac{v_0^2}{2g}=\frac{144}{19.6}=7.35\ \text{m} \] 4. Convert 45 mph to m/s Show Answer \[ 45\ \text{mph} \approx 20.1\ \text{m/s} \] 5. If \(v(t)=6t\) and \(x(0)=0\), find \(x(t)\) Show Answer \[ x(t)=3t^2 \]

docs.title: 🎉 7. Summary Sheet
docs.text: \[ v=\frac{dx}{dt} \qquad  a=\frac{dv}{dt} \] \[ v=v_0+at \qquad x=x_0 + v_0 t + \frac{1}{2}at^2 \]   # 🎓 Week 1 Complete!   [Continue to Week 2 →](../week2/index.md){ .md-button .md-button--primary }
